title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Met virtually with the head of the department to see my qualifications and if I would be a good fit for the position. Talked about my experiences and if I would feel alright in a class setting with young adults. Asked how I give and take criticism to make sure I won't go about it the wrong way with students
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good instructor?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Made process easy and enjoyable. Friendly and accessible members of the department did a zoom call with me. Follow up with Human Resources. Interesting range of courses and opportunities to expand teaching repertoire.
Interview Questions: What criteria do you base raises on?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
It was a very easy and smooth interview process overall. I had a brief phone call with a recruiter to chat about the role and my experience. We scheduled an interview for the following week.

I had one interview, inquiring about my background and experience. I received an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with meeting goals?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
First interview was short, and notified me that I was actually in a pool, and not immediately considered for the job. This was upsetting because the job description doesn't say that you're applying to be in a pool of available candidates.  

Then a second and third interview which went well.  I researched the school and their questions were standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that directly ties into the role you've applied for?

title: Accounts Receivable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Literally 3 long interviews and ended up doing free work for them in the end. I considered invoicing them for my time to draft a collections letter for them. Phone screening was done first and then a video interview with a recruiter. Another video interview was later done with the AR manager and supervisor. One thing I got out of the interviews is that they are serious about AR going to pull students out of class and escort them out for not paying, at least give students options on getting back on track for payments.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work on weekends?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: so many contacts and encouragement, questions by phone 2 times, a long zoom interview, several emails with assistants and I also interviewed a year ago. clearly Bay Area libraries use some people as "interview fodder". and never intend to hire some
Interview Questions: technical requirements, teaching philosophy, cataloging, art visual literacy, databases , diversity, students, library promotion, administration and university atmosphere and service ideas

title: Studio Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had a quick phone interview about my interest in the role and to get any questions I had answered. They followed up in a week with their decision to move forward.
Interview Questions: What was your interest working in a studio lab?

title: Campus Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: One of the easiest I've ever done. I did get to meet my direcr manager and we discussed the job in detail. Felt more like a conversation. I appreciated his honesty about the difficulty of the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about some of your weaknesses

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 Zoom Interviews; which all consisted of the same questions by the interview, 22 multiple question assessment test on HTML, CSS and JavaScript passed with  22/22 correct answers; I was told I receive a score of 95% when in fact it's 100%. The assessment test was time sensitive so i made sure to complete it days before the deadline. The next step was to be another Zoom interview with the Director of Human Resources , the Director of Creative Development and I believe one of  AAUs Deans. Weeks turned to a month of excuses as to way a interview date could not be scheduled. Excuses such as "two of the key players are away", "the department has a lot going on so next week we possibly schedule" etc etc. Until eventually I get a call stating the team decided to go with another candidate they interview weeks before they had interview me which was a clear indication that finale interviews had taken place but despite having the necessary experience and passing their customized assessment quiz with a perfect score. I was not qualified! I should also note that I started the interview process in mid July 2020, and  had I not contacted HR two days ago (9/13/20) I wouldn't known the position had been filled! Complete waste of time!
Interview Questions:
These questions were asked on every Zoom interview and via email during the interview process. 

1.     What are your best qualities that you can contribute to this position? / Why should we hire you?
 
2.     Considering all your criteria and goals for your next career move, how does AAU meet your employment expectations?

3.     How does this role play to your strengths?

4.     How will this role challenge you to grow? 

5.     What other companies/positions are you actively interviewing with and how far along are you in their process?

6.     How does our position compare to the other roles you are considering?
 
7.     How will you go about making your decision if you receive more than one offer?
 
8.     If we were to extend the offer to you today, is there any reason you would decline?

9·   When is the soonest you can start in the role?

10·   Do you have a portfolio or different links you can

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter that worked with me was fantastic. We had open communication throughout the entire process. First was a video interview for a basic screening, then an onsite interview for a meeting with the director. All friendly people!
Interview Questions: What are three things your former boss would describe you as?

title: Architecture Shop Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth, both of my supervisors interviewed me. They gave me a tour of the facility and asked me questions about my experience. I went to architecture school, so I think that helped me in the interview process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have operating a woodshop?

title: Accounts Receivable Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their website and was set up for a three step interview process. Phone screening, Skype interview, and an in person interview with the manager and supervisor. Requires you to do a homework assignment on how you would collect from a student after the Skype interview and the recruiter will also request a credit check before making a offer: They will also offer you a lowball salary at the phone screening. Overall a waste of your time and not worth applying for. Very poor communication from the interviewer and recruiter. Many red flags in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work weekends?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a exam which asked me to solve questions, build a program, and write a document. The questions are easy but time consuming. New knowledge in the test which requires research
Interview Questions: Write codes

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick around two to three weeks in total. Overall easy and pretty regular sessions to get through Held two to three rounds of interviews with both HR and a member of the internal department
Interview Questions: Background questions, related to skills and job experience

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Call or in-person interview with HR, about 45 minutes-1 hour. Second interview with the Assistant Directors, along with a possible meeting with the Director/Executive Director of the department. Very straightforward, but can often get two different viewpoints from HR/the department between interviews. They usually let you know right away whether or not you got the position
Interview Questions: Experience level and comfort with being on the phone/communicating through email

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview is very professional and the person is very kind. It is a good experience. It can give me a good study reference in my future work. I noticed that the office environment is very comfortable, relaxing, and pleasant.
Interview Questions: What similar work experience did you have before?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted by an HR recruiter for an initial phone screening. Went in for an in-person interview with recruiter that was similar to phone screening. Was invited to an in-person interview the following week with directors; that one started around ten minutes late, which interviewers did not apologize for. I did notice one of the interviewers taking off to run off copies of my resume past our interview start time. The recruiter had told me that I would be meeting with the senior director and three associate directors, but what actually happened was that I met separately with two associate directors, and then the senior director, granted "if he was available".
Meeting with the associate directors lasted half an hour (straightforward, they wanted to see what my interpretation of the role was and how my experiences related). Was asked to wait to speak with senior director; this took 5-10 minutes as they took time to debrief about me. 
The interview with the senior director lasted close to an hour. A majority of it was spent listening to my interviewer discuss the specifics of the role as well as his vision and ongoing plans for the advising department. It was a long interview where the interviewer talked about himself more than actually asking the interviewee questions. He emphasized repeatedly the retention aspect of the role and the nature of the day-to-day routine (having more phone and email contact rather than in-person). Not sure if he was trying to convince me out of the role rather than into it.  
Would not recommend. Impression I got was that they focused on finding people who would increase retention/graduation numbers in order to maintain the reputation of the university.
Interview Questions: In your own words, please summarize the role of student services advisor.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via LinkedIn, I had a Skype interview and an other phone Interview with the Faculty evaluation Member. I was asked question about my background and get some advice about how to teach international student
Interview Questions: What's your philosophy of teaching?

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty much just a conversation with the VP of Admissions. I believe it was just a way to assess how you converse since that plays a major role in the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to for the admissions team?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about two weeks and was enjoyable. It started with a quick phone conversation, then we had a FaceTime interview, then an in person interview. I enjoyed the process and everyone I talked with were really nice. I ultimately declined the position due to low pay.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about the Academy of Art University?
Tell me about yourself.
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Veteran Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Be careful, this employer discriminates based upon race and veteran status!  

In summary, recruiter asked me to come in to interview.  But even before I came into interview the she told me the position was already filled.    

Here's the breakdown, I received an email to call the recruiter to schedule an interview.  I called later that day (less than an hour) and the recruiter and I had a short conversation.  At the end of the conversation, we set a date and approximate time.  She let me know that she'd be sending out the confirmation later.  

Anyways, confirmation didn't come.  So, I called and left a VM and emailed her the day after.  After no response for 2 days, I called the HR department on the day of the "interview", the person that answered the phone suggested that I wait for an email even though the interview was supposed to be later that day.  I asked that another person please call me back regarding the "interview".

Several minutes later, I received an email saying that I was no longer under consideration. 

Needless to say, I find this very unprofessional behavior.  "Ghosting" someone is not the way you let them know that the company is not interested.  At any time beforehand, a call or email explaining the situation would have been sufficient.

I can only assume that this snub was based on my race and veteran status since an interview was on conducted.  Instead of resolving the issue they decided to cut me out of the process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: The process was brief and easier than expected. Within a month I received an offer and relocated to SF. I felt that the questions were easy to answer but I prepared for all questions I could think of.
Interview Questions: If faced with a situation you have never handled before, how would you prepare for it?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was covering for another who recently left and was very busy. She was kind, clear, and communicative. I met with the recruiter once and two different managers. The offer came via telephone quickly and smoothly. There was no ability to negotiate due to budget cuts.
Interview Questions: Very typical interview questions relating to passions, motivators, and career experience.

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Immediately after I submitted my application I got a phone call from an HR rep. We briefly discussed my interest in the position and set up a time for an in-person interview. After the interview with HR, I came back in for an interview with my manager. At the end of that interview, I was asked to go back to HR where they offered me the position. Very quick process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your resume.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied approximately 3 months before receiving a random phone call from a recruiter. She held an informal phone interview, asking me to talk about my background and then invited me onsite for an interview with the hiring managers. The whole process was rather strange, as I had to call her several times to actually get the interview scheduled. The in person interview was pretty straightforward and rather conversational in tone. I felt pretty confident when I was told that they wanted to move forward with my application, with the recruiter promising to call me back later in the day with the official word, only to then send me a generic "thanks but no thanks" e-mail a few days later. When i asked for an explanation as to the discrepancy, I received no response.

Don't bait and switch applicants. Be honest and straightforward in the interview process. When applicants ask for feedback, provide it rather than hiding behind your e-mail.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself and what excites you about the position.

title: Marketing Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 4 step process + drug screening.  Recruiter screening call. Mainly informational. That's followed by a phone interview then 2 in-person interviews. All the interviews are pretty easy going except the last one.
Interview Questions: What happens when someone provides feedback on a design and it's critical of your decision?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, didn't hear anything, forgot all about it, and got a call out of the blue three months later asking to come in for an interview that week. 

I was called by somebody from HR, who I met with first in downtown SF. After 30 minutes of pretty casual chatting, they bussed me 40 minutes across the city in a private shuttle in which I was the only passenger. The woman from HR told me that I would meet with the VP of admissions, who was very decisive and "hires very interesting people."

At the next location I spoke with the VP of Admissions for around 30 minutes. He asked no typical interview questions, but instead different versions of "tell me about yourself." It seemed like the idea was to get me talking, and to see if I could talk well, because talking well was an essential job requirement. Next he brought in somebody who had the job I was applying for, and we talked about day-to-day job functions. He seemed to stress the fact that is was a lot of talking on the phone, and that sometimes it's hard to keep up because everyone has "a pretty big portfolio." After that, the VP brought in the director of admissions, who essentially asked me the same kinds of thing as the VP. At the end of our conversation, the director of admissions told me that they agreed that I seemed like a great fit for the position. I was called by the woman from HR later that day and told they would like to get started with the hiring process/background checks. 

I imagine that if you want to do well in this interview, you have to know how to talk well and present yourself well, and everything else will come easily.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself"

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in May/June and got an email back in August asking me to call the HR person. When I called we talked briefly about my resume and set up an in person interview with her the next week. She also set up an interview with the VP of Undergrad Admissions the same day.  The phone call was straightforward and she didn't really ask me any questions and just said she felt very confident in my abilities based on my resume which is why she set up both interviews in one day. (For some background: I just graduated from one of the top three art universities in the US and worked in my school's admissions office for three years.)

I came in for the interview which was just a very casual conversation. I think because I was selling myself and gave examples on my knowledge and previous interactions with students and parents she didn't need to ask me many questions. If anything, she just helped me prepare for my next interview and gave me more information about the job. It was very nice because I felt like she just really wanted me to succeed. I felt very wanted as she walked me out and put me on the bus to get to the Undergraduate Admissions Office to interview with the VP.

This interview was a bit more formal but not by much. The VP was personable and actually gave me good advice on how he got to the position he has now. We discussed skills a bit and at a certain point I think he already made his mind up and we just had casual conversations on interests and life. He then introduced me to someone who would be my coworker and I got the chance to speak with her one-on-one about the pros and cons and daily work life. Then he introduced me to the person who would be my manager and after the VP took the time to walk me out of the building to the school's bus stop. I came out of it very confident I got the job.

I got a call that same day with a verbal offer and that all three people unanimously said yes! After submitting references and a background check I got a formal written offer.
Interview Questions: No questions were really asked.

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty average interview with a 3 step process: Phone screening, meeting with HR business partners and a final interview with HR manager and vp of HR.  People were friendly and the HR manager was pretty responsive and nice. However, they don't follow-up with you when you're not the candidate that they want.
Interview Questions: How does your current role fit into this position?

title: Lead Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I felt the interview process was speedy and thorough. I was able to get a feeling of what the mission of the Academy was and how I can contribute.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview went as follows: Screening call, onsite with recruiter, onsite with direct report, compute skills online test, and onsite with hiring manager. The process was overall quick and straight forward, the recruiter works to make sure you are interviewing in a school which fits your skill set.
Interview Questions: Are you able to speak and collaborate with people whose first language is not English ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Email survey, 20 min phone interview with Human Resources rep. Follow up via email. Was a cattle call process and not interested in seeing potential growth for prospective employees. I don’t know how many more words it takes to get to 30 words minimum.
Interview Questions: What about your previous experience makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Account Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was reached out by one of the recruiter representative who was kind. She provided me of the job description, hourly rate, when is my availability. She then emailed me an excerpt to reply to. I was then offered to meet with the managers for an in-person interview. After the interview, I received a phone call of the offer.
Interview Questions: Why Academy of Art?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: I received an email about setting up an initial phone interview. I set up a time with them, and then the woman who was supposed to call me, emailed me and asked if we could reschedule because she got pulled into a meeting. This was understandable, so I said yes, we could reschedule and told her when I was available. I never heard back from her. In the next few days that followed, I contacted her again as well as the original person who contacted me, just in case there had been some miscommunication. I never heard from either of them again, which I find very unprofessional. Do not contact someone to set up an interview and then never follow up. So strange and off-putting.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received the call, had an in-person interview in couple of days. Second interview with admin department representatives was held in couple of days afterwards. Final interview was with 2 directors and office manager, which was the crucial one. Got the offer after couple of days after background check and references` input.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about the Academy? What was your previous job?
How do you see yourself in this kind of a school?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was great, the recruiter was very easy to speak with.  I was asked a series of questions regarding hourly availability to see if it was a match and was informed of the contractual parameters for the position.
Interview Questions: They asked regarding preferred salary, it seems like they are working out competitive rates for the position.

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I first received a phone interview which took about 15 minutes. At the end a in person interview was scheduled. After then a interview with  managers at once. They each ask questions and jot down answers
Interview Questions: Basic questions i.e. strengths, weaknesses, name a time you had to meet deadlines, etc.

title: Procurement Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held via skype and took about 15 minutes. The questions were all very standard, mostly about my experience. Preceding the interview was a phone screening conversation/mini-interview, I wasn't very prepared for this as I hadn't expected to hear from them.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a manager

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone screening, a few days later, Skype interview, and then onsite Interview. Interview process was smooth and very professional-- all questions were standard. Also required to take a skills test on Excel and Word-- that was a bit more tricky.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deliver bad or negative news to another employee

title: Academy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a 1:1 phone screen with HR, then a 1:1 in person with another person from HR. After that, I met up with the manager of academic advisors for a 1:1. The interview went well, manager even said she wished she could give me the good news right away, but she had to contact her VP first. However, after this interview, I did not hear back from AAU. Sent two follow up emails. Still no response. Extremely unprofessional and rude.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did 3 interviews. 1 over Skype with an HR Rep. 1 in person with my manager. 1 over the phone with the VP of Financial Aid. Overall took about 2 months.
Interview Questions: It was less typical interview questions and more about how they wanted to change the culture there and if you would fit in.

title: Photo Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Answered some email inquires to cover basic information, then telephone call to better understand the job's requirements and expectations. Right away the interviewer understood the hurtles of moving to the Bay area, but was very helpful in seeking solutions, possible benefits of working for the school. Unfortunately, there were no health benefits for a position that is basically seasonal; 3 times a year, classifying employee as part-time. It's a challenge trying to live and work in the Bay area due to the massive living costs, institutions will be hard pressed to get fresh talent from outside the city.
Interview Questions: Ability to relocate to the city with the salary offered.

title: Online Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact from recruiter. A writing sample was requested biased on a specific scenario. Department interview. HR Interview, Background Screening. Then Executive approval. Everyone was very friendly and willing to work with you through out the process.  From start to finish the recruiter was encouraging and helpful and answered all of my questions,
Interview Questions: What process would you use to recommend a change in procedure?

title: Graduate Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Well-handled and organized. A representative of the university called and checked in between stages and I was accommodated with phone and Skype interviews when I could not be there in person.  Interactions were warm, informative, and lots of details and reminders were provided via email as well. I always knew where I stood in the interview process.
Interview Questions: Key in all stages: describing my interest and fit with the role in question and how my background led me to this role.

title: International Admissions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview by phone and face-to-face was amazing. The interviewer was friendly and extremely professional at the same time. She made very specific questions, and made me feel very comfortable during the interview. We reviewed together my resume and the job requirements, and discussed salary and schedule as well.
Interview Questions: Why I was looking for a different job?

title: Student Accounts Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview went smoothly, both the manager and the assistant manager were very professional, and informative. They were friendly and asked just enough questions that lead me to believe they were interested in hearing what I had to say. We were in a large conference type room for the interview, which was nice. It was a very spacious room as to not make anyone feel too enclosed. Interviews are stressful enough and small rooms make it harder to think and feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: International Admissions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I have been working in the same industry for years and understand thoroughly about the scope of duties this position requires. I have been following the university and applied online when the position opened up. I received an email from the recruiter within two days followed by the short phone interview.

I had many questions prepared for the recruiter as I wanted to know the types of students I will be working with and whether or not I will be working with an international education consulting agency. I also asked other simple questions such as which campus will I be working it, who will I be reporting to, and etc. HOWEVER, the recruiter just laughed and said she knew nothing more about the position and she's just being told to give me a call. I am sorry AAU - it looks like you hired the wrong person as your recruiter to begin with. I was very confident about my background and competency about this role but end up feeling very negative and sorry for AAU after the phone call.

After not being able to answer any of my questions, the recruiter said she will get back to me within a few days for another follow-up. Two days after I received an email saying that this position has already been filled and they are not looking anymore.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking? What do you not like about your current role that you want to work for AAU?

title: Immigration Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Basically the HR lady told me that even though this is a visa issued/management job at the international office,  it is expected the person to sell the university to potential students. Basically, they want you to sell and market the school to the potential students, which is highly unusual for this kind of position.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous jobs workload and if I mind working on the weekend.

title: International Admission Specialist (Bilingual) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and got an interview invite the next day. Confirm a phone interview within a week. I got a confirmation email 3 days later to inform that I was not able to move on. HR staff handled the process very professionally and efficient.  I asked benefits and working hours but HR staff was not able to provide too much info on benefits. Working hours are wired Tuesday - Sat 10am-7pm with 1 hour unpaid lunch break. 10 paid vacation + 9 sick leave.
Interview Questions:
Q1. Why do you want to apply for this job?

Q2. Tell me what do you do at your current job?

Q3: What is your expected salary? (Their offer rage is between 40k-48k DOE)

Q4: What is your career goal?

Q5. What questions do you have for us?

title: Outreach Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: I got a Skype interview first, and then a face-to-face interview with my supervisor. The whole process is positive and pretty standard. No tough questions. They just interested to know you and how you can be a fit for this job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty standard. You meet with someone from HR for a preliminary interview, then interview with a few people in the Admissions department. The position isn't quite what they describe online. Once I went through the interview process and spoke to various people that worked there it sounded more and more like just a sales representative.
Interview Questions: What do you understand about our school?

title: Campus Host Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call to schedule an interview at their 79 New Montgomery building. I was told to dress professional and to bring a copy of my resume. I ended up interviewing with one of the heads of security and a person from the human resources department. After passing the interview process I received an email from a company to enter in my information so they could preform a background check. After passing the background check I was ask to come back to the 79 New Montgomery building to fill out a bunch of paperwork before starting.
Interview Questions: To describe what I thought the job entailed. What my experience was

title: Financial Aid Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: went through phone interview, followed by a Skype interview, then a in person interview, very basic questions, customer service based interview questions, financial experience is a plus but not required
Interview Questions: do you have any financial aid experience

title: Customer Service Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
My interaction with the AAU's recruiter was positive, the department I'd be working for-ehh.
Through the whole process I felt like the recruiter was in my corner, routing for me, giving me tips, giving me updates on the status, or even if there was no update- she'd call and say "Thanks for your patience, we haven't made a decision yet. I'll call again on Friday to check in." 

First, very positive in-person interview with recruiter.

The second interview was with two representatives from the department I'd be working in. One couldn't keep his eyes off of his phone. Ultimately, he excused himself to make a phone call. He returned to the room and then had to leave again! His ins and out definitely broke my concentration and gave a weird vibe to the environment. I repeated some of my answers when he returned, but he was disengaged. This guy seemed to be in a very high position at AAU and very removed from the role of the position I was interviewing for. Clearly, his phone calls triumphed a measly interview. After I had this second interview the recruiter called to check in again. She said they really liked me and was considered one of the top candidates (despite all the awkwardness of the interview!). It was like I was getting a sneak peak about into the other side from the recruiter! 

A lengthy process overall and ultimately was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: What technologies are you skilled in?

title: Cook II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Two managers interviewed me for 30 minutes each, and the questions were settled in a written document. The first interviewer friendly inspire my confidence showed the interviewee.
The questions were difficult for me because its technical nature about it.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell us about your background:

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: i received a phone call the next day after I submitted an online application, the phone call was from HR dept about 3-5 mins, scheduled for two onsite interviews the following week - with HR and with your team managers, about 30 minutes each, easy-avg questions, mostly strength & weakness questions. Then received a phone call with offer after 3-5 days.
Interview Questions: why do you think we should hire you for the job

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Quick 15 minute phone interview
30 minute interview with HR recruiter
30 minute interview with hiring manager

Everyone was so friendly and welcoming. I felt heard and cared for as an interviewer. The human resources recruiter I worked with was incredible at communicating and answering emails on a timely manner.
Interview Questions: How would you express to parents the importance of their student pursuing the arts?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Step one was a Skype interview, which went just fine and actually left me thinking that, perhaps, all of the terrible, negative reviews online might be wrong.  After the initial Skype interview, I was invited in for an onsite interview with the same woman I had spoken with on Skype.  This, also, seemed to go fine.  I was then asked to come back again, mind you I lived three hours away, to do a fake presentation and tour for the same woman and two managers, a male and female.  This part was awkward.  I get what they were trying to do, but both during the "role play" and outside of it, these two managers were two of the worst humans I've ever come across.  The female manager seems as if she must be absolutely miserable in her personal life, and she's taking it out on anyone and everyone that comes near her.  The male manager was ok, but seemed to be overpowered by the harsh, abrasive female counterpart.  They made me feel so unwelcome, I cannot even imagine working for them on a day-to-day basis.  In my opinion, and from currently being in an HR position, this is NOT how you want to make interview candidates feel.  You should want your candidate to feel welcome and feel like this is a company that they would love to work for.  No wonder this institution can't keep employees!  They treat you terribly and constantly push their own misery off on you.  After the miserable interview process, they take weeks to get back to you with updates.  Everything about this place is unprofessional and uninviting.  The HR department at Academy of Art University should truly be ashamed of how these employees represent the university.  I'd rather flip Big Macs for minimum wage at McDonald's than work here.
Interview Questions: I had to give a presentation to the managers as if I were presenting to potential students.

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: initial phone screen...as long as you can answer some basic sales oriented questions then you move on the another recruiter who has you come In for a face to face...if all good then you interview with director of admissions
Interview Questions: What do you know about the university

title: Campus Tours Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call after about 2 weeks. The person I spoke to in HR was extremely excited about my resume, so much so that she wanted me to interview for another position (an administrative assistant position) as well. That way, she said, I could choose between the two.  She emailed me the job description for the administrative position so I can decide. I had done my M.A. in England, something she seemed excited about. In fact, she liked me to so much, that she wanted me to come in for an in-person interview the following day. However, when I went in, she seemed completely shocked at who she saw - a young, hispanic woman. She took me into her office and looked like she really didn't want to interview me. She almost seemed offended by me. She had no recollection of mentioning two positions to me. She looked uncomfortable the whole time she was sitting there and hardly asked me any questions, and the ones she did ask were stupid, condescending questions. When I asked her about the extracurricular activites available to students, she literally went on their website and showed me the list with no elaboration. This was something she just wanted to quickly end. The in-person interview lasted about 5 minutes before she rushed me out to the elevator. I'm pretty sure that was my first time experiencing blatant discrimination in an interview. I never expected a call back.
Interview Questions: Have you ever talked on the phone? Do you know how to use email? Have you written a lot of emails?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got a phone interview within a week, and scheduled in-person interview within a month. The interview was conducted in HR with a follow up with Student Affairs over the span of a few days in SF.
Interview Questions: How do you manage things when your manager isn't around?

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: The first stage is a 15 minute phone interview, and if they are still interested in you after the phone interview you are invited for an in-person interview. The in-person interview is one on one for about 30 minutes, and it was a very pleasant experience. They are definitely focused on finding someone who is able to effectively communicate over the phone, so I would not apply if this is something you do not enjoy.
Interview Questions: Do you feel confident and comfortable contacting potentially interested students over the phone?

title: Digital Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone screening with a recruiter. From there, I was moved to the next stage of the interview process, which was an in-person panel discussion with a manger and lead technician. Overall, it was an extremely easy interview.
Interview Questions: What do you like about photography? How would you deal with foreign language students? How many years have you been shooting photos? Do you have experience working with digital printers.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a call center position and was contacted the next day. I spoke to the recruiter on the phone and she was great at answering my questions and telling me about the job. I came for an in person interview with the recruiter the follwing week and met the managers right after. Both of these interviews were very detailed, thet asked lots of questions. I then recieved a call the next day to do references and I have since started my new job. The experience was very smooth and quick!
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself motivated?

title: Customer Service Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the job awhile ago and then forgot about it, because it took about a month until I heard anything.

The recruiter seemed great, she was easy to speak to, understood where I was coming from and thought that I would be a great fit for the job.  I did too, that's why I applied.  

The first step was a telephone interview with the recruiter, that went well.  The next step was an in-person interview with the recruiter a couple of days later.  She took lots of notes, again told me she thought I was a great fit and then she scheduled me for an in-person interview, for the next day, with the woman who would be my boss if I got the job.

The morning of the interview the recruiter called me and told me that she needed more information, because the woman I was interviewing with was questioning my resume and whether or not I had call center experience.  Keep in mind I stated, many times, in both interviews with the recruiter, that no I had never managed call center staff, but had managed support staff, for many years, in an environment where help was requested via telephone, email, a ticketing system, etc.

Now running a bit behind due to the last minute phone call I went over for my next interview.  During the interview I had the overwhelming feeling that the woman could not wait to get me out of her office and had zero interest in me.  It was extremely uncomfortable and by the end of the interview (a whopping 20 minutes) I couldn't wait to get out of there myself.  

After I came home I wrote a follow-up email to the recruiter thanking her for setting up the interview and asking her to please let me know the outcome either way.  Zero response!

As they were looking to fill the position within a week and I've heard nothing I can only assume that I didn't get the position.  It would have been nice to receive an email letting me know that they went with another candidate, but that didn't happen, which I find very unprofessional (not to mention the last minute call and the fact that the woman at the call center having zero interest in me).  I did read several reviews on Glassdoor about this same thing happening (i.e. apply, interview, hear nothing) and now I know it to be true.

I've been the hiring manager several times and if someone takes the time to come in and interview with me I take the time to send them an email at the very least.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked at a call center?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by the Recruiter via phone. We scheduled a phone interview which went well and then an in person interview. The Recruiter sounded super nice over the phone and said that if this position wasn't a fit- she would find something that might be a better fit, so it seemed hopeful. 
I came into the office and a peculiar thing: the candidates that were interviewing for this position were sitting waiting for their interview time, seems they schedule it similar to a casting call. 
Everything went well, but towards the middle of the interview her questions felt like she was demeaning and asking why I am even applying for this position. I didn't feel like this was relative to my interview. I worked for a similar educational for type of environment and the recruiting process is the opposite. I decided that whether or not I was going to get the position I would definitely pass, the Recruiter was not professional, and this would parallel the organization. The Recruiter did not even follow up to let me know the results either.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel like your past experience relates to this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through linkedin. Was denied first application. Was then called for a job that better suited my qualifications. Short easy phone interview. Was then called in for second interview with HR head. A very easy interview, most lead by my questions. There will be a third interview with direct suoervisiers this week if choosen from applicants.
Interview Questions: Asked how I deal with angry or frustrated students.

title: Financial Aid Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had my first interview with HR recruiter and went over the resume. I had to explain each job I had and reasons of leaving the job. Later, I had a second interview with the financial aid managers and was a 20 min. interview very casual.
Interview Questions: Share a story where you provided great customer service

title: International Student Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on website, but the site was having glitches, so I followed up with the Recruiting Assistant who posted the position on LinkedIn, he graciously offered to forward my resume on. About a week or so later I heard from the Recruiter to arrange a phone interview. She was very nice, responsive to emails and seemed to have really read my resume and understood my track. This was just before Thanksgiving, so I didn't expect things to move quickly. 

But I heard back that the VP of this unit wanted to interview with me about 2 weeks later, so I agreed working around her strict schedule. Then the Recruiter contacted me the day before the interview to cancel as the VP was no longer available. So we re-scheduled for a date about a week later, but as soon as I arrived and was waiting in the lobby the Recruiter informed me that the VP cancelled again last minute, but no explanation, etc. The Recruiter still met with me for a few minutes, we had already discussed my background on the phone, and she didn't know the details of the position, so I couldn't ask any questions. She said she would find out the VP's availability to re-schedule "again" but never heard from them again. I followed up with the Recruiter immediately with a calm and friendly thank you note and asking for the next interview date, but still nothing. 

As I'm still new in my current role and don't have a flexible schedule (which I explained very well to the Recruiter), it was very difficult to arrange this time off work, specially twice, and then to not even be interviewed was completely unacceptable. I had heard very negative things through former employees, etc. about the lack of seriousness, it being just a tuition factory and there being no focus on student services or staff development, but I decided to form my own opinion. I still can't believe that such a public entity who already has a bad reputation is still doing nothing to improve that, seemingly both internally and externally. So now two months later and still nothing, I am counting my blessings that I never heard back as the is says everything about this so called "university" which is more of a real estate venture.
Interview Questions: Mostly just that the Recruiter didn't seem familiar with the position, international student services, visas, or the details of the department, so it what somewhat difficult to talk about my experience.

title: Photography Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for a phone interview two days later. That was pretty brief, with an overview of some of my experience and of this position. She told me the pay is $13/hour, that night and weekend shifts are pretty much required, and that it's a position contracted for each semester. She asked if that was all okay, I said yes, and she set up an in-person interview with HR for me. That interview was pretty straight-forward, mainly reviewing my resume and me talking about my experience. I was told this interview would be just 30 minutes with her, but that went well so they sent me to another site to meet with the photo lab managers. Luckily I had free time that afternoon because the process unexpectedly took about 2 hours. The in-depth technical interview with the actual photo hiring managers was much more difficult and they had a lot of specific questions about my experience with equipment. Before we sat down for the interview, they showed me around the facilities and explained a lot of what I would be doing. They seemed pretty nice and I could tell it was going well. Toward the end they showed me the perks--a nice shirt and jacket uniform, a key card, and he said I would be getting health insurance, which makes sense because the job is full-time. The original woman I interviewed on the phone with called me back that afternoon to offer me the position and she also informed me, however, that the job does not include health benefits because it is "part time." Although it's a minimum of 40 hours per week, you don't working for the entire period between semesters and need to be rehired, so they're able to label it part time. That was on a Thursday and I took the weekend to think about it, ultimately informing her on Monday that I was going to turn it down.
Interview Questions: They asked about whether or not I had used various types of equipment and specifically which ones, like lighting, C-stands, cameras, etc.

title: International Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I talked to human resources and then went into the office to talk to two managers. It was a quick and good talk and they called me the next day to tell me that i was hired.
Interview Questions: Describe your past

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted after answering an advertisement on Craigslist for a full-time faculty member.  I could hardly believe I found the ad there, but answered anyway.  They called me three times asking me to come out for a visit.  I was told I would be interviewed and that I was there "first choice."  Weeks passed without any contact or offer of flying me out, until they called again and told me just to buy my own ticket and they would reimburse me.  I booked a cheap hotel (125$) for two nights in Oakland and the cheapest r/t flight I could find.  I printed my receipts.  

When I got to San Francisco, I had been given the number of the President, by the Director who was in contact with me.  She never answered my calls when I called, nor did she return my calls.  This was not a good sign. So I inquired with the Director.  He seemed as frustrated as I was and called her and managed to set up a meeting between me and her at the Palace Hotel during lunch hour the next day.  She came to that meeting an hour late accompanied by her assistant , she is a sort of enforcer for the President.  The president was overly familiar, fake-friendly and under-curious about me, which always sets off bells.  But apparently I was hired.  She asked me where I was staying and I told her.  She had my hotel switched to a fancy one, but didn't offer to pay for the one I had already booked or my expensive flight.  She told me there was "one more step" in the hiring process and that was passing approval from her father. The following day I was to meet her and him at Trader Vic's for lunch.  We met there, and both arrived in black limos that had a sort of mobster dirty feel.  Hers said "I (heart) art" on the license plate.  The Father proved to be someone who dominates in conversation, interrupts, and tries to throw in the clever line just when you are getting serious about your answers.  He was pompous and down-talking.  I had brought along a small original noted piece of my expensive artwork.  It was of a famous black woman. He looked at it and immediately commented, "Are you a communist?" (with some self sniggering).  Awkward.  Apparently I was hired after this, but felt disgusted and unenthused about the owners of this school.  The process did not get any better after this.  I never got reimbursed for the hotel or flight until nearly 8 months later, even though the President paraded me around the 79 building telling everyone she "flew me out here" to interview.  She agreed to pay only half my moving expenses which amounted to $10k.  Those also never were paid until I had contacted the administration 4 times about it well into the second half of my first year on the job, which was nothing as she had described it in the interview.  She had described a job of creativity and teaching where I would teach at a high level with autonomy.  It was nothing like what was described.  No faculty had autonomy, and every aspect of classroom teaching was controlled from curriculum to syllabus, to attendance forms which were expected three times each class period!  Everything presented in the interview was a sham and a lie.  I spent three years here before leaving for a much better opportunity.  Do not fall for this place.
Interview Questions: Are you a communist?

title: Cybercampus Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in-person interview with department manager.  As long as you are even slightly competent with using a computer, you shouldn't have any problems.  It helps to be proficient with both PC and Mac.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty simple interview with basic questions such as why my interest in the position and what I could contribute to the position. It was with the hiring manager for the department.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a situation that was difficult to resolve.

title: Department Assistant, Undergrad Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First applied on line, it took about 4 days to get a reply. 
Next step was a 20 mins phone interview, after received the reply message in two days.
After phone interview, will need to do a web test about typing, data entry and MS office work.
Still waiting for next step.
Interview Questions:
Phone interview wasn't too difficult, it was about 20 mints.
Questions like, why do you think you will fit for this position?

title: Part Time Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: After an employee referral I was invited to a group interview with an administrator I never saw again during my 3 years of employment. No questions were asked, I just listened as she told me about company policy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Design Shop Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was extremely straight forward and easy. Little to no technical questions. Was processed directly through a human resources representative. Process was streamlined and took only a few weeks. HR was fairly responsive and easy to get in touch with. Most of the questions were about personal background and past experiences.
Interview Questions: What prior similar job experience do you have?

title: Video/Audio Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a short phone interview with a recruiter where they briefly described the work and the salary range. Then had an interview with two department heads a few days later. Mostly they just ask about my experiences with software and equipment. It was a very candid interview, no strange questions or tricks. A very comfortable experience, and everyone was very nice.
Interview Questions: The interview was very straight forward, so none.

title: International Admissions Specialist - Bilingual Mandarin Chinese/English Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring ad was on Craigslist, first submit the resume through email, then a phone interview. The first round interview is about 10 minutes. I think the hiring ad is quite specific about the requirement, so it worth while to read it thoroughly and find out hoe much the match can be.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Why do you leave you current job?

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the Undergraduate Admissions Representative position online. Within a few days, I was contacted by a recruiter via email to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview consisted of the recruiter providing background information on the university, position, and projected salary. I was asked to go over my resume and explain my reasoning and interest in working for the organization. I was also asked to provide examples of how my experiences fit the role. Throughout the interview, the recruiter was professional and friendly. The person asked questions that were fair and appropriate for the position .

After the resume overview, one is directed to ask any questions they have about the position. During the interview, I asked a number of questions which helped me determine the position was actually for a salesperson and not a student counselor or advisor role. Based on the helpful information, I was able to make the accurate decision to decline an on-site interview.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions during the interview. The interviews questions were standard.

title: Online Content Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an email a day or two later, requesting a phone interview. The lady on the phone was very nice and asked some standard questions to see if I was a good fit. 

She then offered me an in-person interview which was held two days later. I was interviewed by the director and the department manager. It was not organized well. There was no room available for the interview. After walking through the building to find a room, we went back to the lobby and conducted the interview there. 

Both very friendly and nice but none of them had seriously read my resume. Basic information about myself were apparently perceived wrong so I had to clarify. It was then, when I started suspecting they actually don't think I was a good fit. The manager tried to make a case that my interest in languages exceeds the requirements for the job, that I was over-qualified somehow, I guess. That is despite the fact that I had more than four years experience in exactly that field. They said it was an entry-level position so I really did not understand questioning my motivation to apply. 

We then went on to the transcription test, to "see if you can do the job". There was little introduction but I was asked to transcribe a short excerpt from a graphic design lesson. It was a simple task. He said I would have ten minutes, however it was more like five minutes. I know because I only transcribed about five minutes with maybe a minute to replay some passages that were hard to understand. He then asked me to revise and proofread what I wrote, this time without any time limit. I did so and then said I was ready. After that he just sent me home. 

A week later I got an email that they have decided to go with somebody else.
Interview Questions: No unexpected or difficult questions except they asked if I had any experience in copy editing which was not a prerequisite in the job description.

title: Gallery Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Senior manager did not show up to scheduled interview. Major let down. Many of my questions left unanswered. Without the senior staff member available to speak the interview felt incomplete. Upon requesting another chance or any opportunity to speak with her, I was ignored entirely by HR.
Interview Questions:
I ask: Which aspect of the role is most critical to operations?
Response: It doesn't matter. It can be really dead sometimes, so what will you do with your time?

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Usually a minimum of 3 interviews, phone screen, in person HR, and in person hiring manager. It is important to demonstrate your passion for the arts and education and putting the student first.
Interview Questions: Role playing questions. I luckily had worked in higher education admissions previously which helped me to know what type of answer they were looking for, although it's really about engaging with the student and being able to overcome obstacles

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with a recruiter who was nice, interview with HR who was personable and friendly, final interview with the two directors of admissions. Directors were boring in comparison and had a sales mentality. HR did not share similar views about the position so when the directors explained, it was a surprise.
Interview Questions: How would you measure success in this position?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact took place in February. Months went by without follow up. Heard back again via email and began conversations in April. Recruiters were pleasant and professional, straight forward interview with offer two weeks later.
Interview Questions: They really weren't trying to stump me. The position requires a set knowledge base and experience, all of which I have.

title: Academy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: one phone interview, one skype interview, and one in person interview.  Took 4 weeks to complete process and they seemed like the were making it a lengthy process intentionally. It was exciting but stressful at the same time
Interview Questions: Had to complete 4 academic tests. Had to answer "What do you expect out of management" and other questions related.

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email about setting up an initial phone screening. At the end of the phone screening, was asked about coming in for an interview. Attended an in-person interview with an HR rep.
Interview Questions: Roleplay: You call a student who you believe may be interested in attending Art U, but on the phone they seem very uninterested and unsure. Get them interested and make them want to come to Art U.

title: Front Desk Administrative Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: I received a response quickly through email after submitting my application.  I also received a follow up email with some interview questions such as "why do you want to work here, etc."  After sending in my responses, a short phone interview was scheduled.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal manager?

title: Art Model Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
1.) Get in contact with hiring manager.
2.) State your intentions the semester BEFORE you want to work and management will send an email with a set of questions to fill out.
3.) Submit photos and responses to email.
4.) If you pass, meet with employer for 1-on-1 interview for more information.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a model? (Are you just in it for the money or is there a special reason why you chose this position at this school?)

title: Academic Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The HR recruiting team is a well oiled machine that gives you the illusion that AAU also works in similar fashion, however once you are employed you find out rather quickly that is not the case.  Once hired I discovered that the hoops that you have to jump through to get the job are not worth it - the multiple phone interviews, multiple in person interviews and the qualifications tests do not reflect what the actual job will be like.
Interview Questions: Are you smarter than the last idiot who had this job (no joke, that is what I was asked).

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and cover letter online. Two days later I received an email requesting additional information - 4 interview questions, and desired salary  & start date. I also completed a 1/2 hour phone interview, a 1/2 hour Skype interview and a test on grammer/proofreading, Excel and Word (took about 2 hours to complete). Finally called in to an in person interview with the head of the department about 3 weeks after my initial submission. The head of the department was not prepared for an interview and asked me no questions about myself or professional experience - spent the whole time complaining about the current support staff.  She asked me to come in for further interviews with her staff and said she would contact me directly and I never heard from anyone at the Academy of Art again.
Interview Questions: No hard questions, but it was difficult to "sell" myself to the hiring manager because she spent the whole time talking!

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
1) Phone interview with recruiter
2) 1:1 with recruiter
3) 1:3 with recruiter, hiring manager, VP
4) spontaneous phone interview with VP
Interview Questions: How do I know that you care about the vision and goals of the advancement of art education?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process for this position was very lengthy. Several phone/Skype interviews. I actually was in town and set-up a time to meet with the staff in the office. Interview was the same as phone interviews - same questions. I heard back the following week with a decline. 

I was very proactive and really tried to express my passion and commitment to the position, how willing I was to move, etc etc.
Interview Questions: Your background is in the sciences, how do you think this will affect your ability to connect with Arts students?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for this position via Skype, as I did not live in the immediate area, and had to sit for three Skype interviews and one in-person interview total.  Once I arrived for my in-person interview, they were running late, and never bothered to notify me if I did indeed get the job in the time they specified.  I had to continuously email them, and was finally given my answer by their automated email service.
Interview Questions: What kind of candy do you like most in the world?  Ok, now sale me that piece of candy. (unexpected)

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Highly misleading. Recruiter grossly oversold the position and company and misrepresented both the type of work to be done and the environment in which it would be completed. They will hire almost anyone.
Interview Questions: Only extraordinarily basic questions were asked. None stand out, or were remarkably insightful/challenging.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
