Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I was contacted by HR.It was an email asking if I was interested, then set up a phone interview. After I pass, scheduled a one-on-one with HR then met with the director of the department on the same day. A few days later, I got a phone call offering the position.
Interview Questions: The phone interview is pretty typical as well as the one-on-one with HR. Questions such as, where do you see yourself in 5 years? Tell me something about yourself? Scenarios questions handling difficult customer. If you're good at interviewing, you'll be fine but if you have a hard time, do research on the company and apply your abilities and past experience to the job.

title: E-learning Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer wasn't very professional and seemed more uncomfortable than I was or just didn't care to interview. Or perhaps they had already chosen someone for the position and were just going through the motions to get through my already scheduled interview.
Interview Questions: Hands on 'test' with very little direction or instruction. Just 'fix' the web layout isn't really a way to test someones skill. Not what I expected from a design school.

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Be professional, you talk to three tiers of people: staffing, recruiting, then the director of the branch you're in. Helpful to be yourself, but a more corporate version of yourself.
Interview Questions: The typical "where do you see yourself five years from now/what do you have difficulty with/why are you a good fit here" corporate questions.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
-1 month time frame
-phone interview/screening followed by a panel and additional individual meetings 
-background took quite some time 
-when discussing benefits they avoid going into specific details and often leave certain details out, like Saturday work days 
-training is about a month long, with exams that determine whether or not you can move forward in your position 
-real understanding happens when you are on the floor
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had one meeting with the heads of the department and was hired.  I knew them previously, so they knew my work standard.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application and received a call from an HR representative about a month later. We spoke for about 10 minutes about my relevant skills and why I was interested in the position, and then set up an interview at the site with another HR representative for the following week. I met with the HR representative for about 45 minutes, answering questions about why I wanted the job and some specific scenario questions about how I would motivate students. I was then referred to meet with the direct supervisors the same week. The interview was pretty much a repeat of the previous one, with a few more specific questions about what I expect from management and what I plan to be doing in the next 5 years. I was told later that the interview went well, my references were contacted, and then I waited with no contact for two weeks. Finally I was contacted by the HR representative to let me know that a committee decided not to hire me. I was given no reasoning as to why, after being approved by both HR and my direct supervisors, that I was rejected. The environment felt very cold and corporate, surprisingly bureaucratic for an art school.
Interview Questions: What kind of work environment do I like? What do I see myself doing in 5 years?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Skyped with the recruiter after applying online. One of the requirements was that you had to be a College graduate to work within any of the departments (this is now not the case). Went through a phone interview and then had a face-to-face with the recruiter. After a week, I had an interview with the President of the Student Services department for the final stage.
Interview Questions:
Why would you like to work at Academy of Art University?
Tell us about your experience in working with non-responsive individuals?
Are you a team player or leader? Explain.
Are you process or detail-oriented?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Once I submitted the online application with my resume, I had a phone interview with an off-site recruiter. The off-site recruiter had me take 2 online tests consisting of administrative organizational questions such as filing numbers or explanations of how I would schedule. Afterward, the onsite recruiter interviewed about my experience asking general questions of management, filing and etc. Finally, the department director interviewed me asking me about my strengths & weaknesses as well as about my professionalism.
Interview Questions: How would you organize your director's project ideas and scheduling needs?

title: Art Model Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: met model coordinator and went from there. I really just want to read the job review I was looking at. Can I please get back to that for the love of god. I've been filling out this form for 5 mins now and you assured me that it would only take a minute to "unlock" the review I wanted to read.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter to set up a phone screen. The phone screen was rescheduled a few times, and was an "hour slot" instead of a specific time so I had to find a quiet spot and wait for the call for an hour. Recruiter was generally friendly and nice, asked some basic questions.
Interview Questions: Standard questions--why are you interested in the position (though they are the ones that contacted me)?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Sent resume after seeing a job posting for the position. A recruiter called me a couple of weeks later for a phone interview. Then I was asked to come in and meet with HR and the manger of the department.
Interview Questions: Straight forward questions based around experience and motivations. No difficult or unexpected questions

title: Data Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Attended an open house and waited for two hours to meet with a recruiter, who I spoke with for only 15 minutes. I was told to take an online typing test at home to see if I qualify for an interview.
Interview Questions: Data Entry Clerk

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went to one of the recruitment calls they posted on Craigslist. I had to wait a long time to meet with a recruiter. The recruiter was difficult to talk to and not very welcoming. She also didn't understand my questions, including simple ones like "Is there a variety of duties?" She asked me to repeat it and said “I don’t understand that question.” The interview was also very short.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, set up a phone interview a week later. Had an in person meeting with the director and my future manager. Heard a week later that I would start the next month. The interviews were all very short, quick questions. I remember asking around 10 questions myself and i was in and out of the office in 20 minutes.  Felt unsure if they got a feel for me and my experience, but received a voicemail a few days later congratulating me. I believe they hired me based on my experience in education and international work.
Interview Questions: Past experience. Why an Art University? International/visa experience?

title: International Admission Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: First they contacted me through email to set up a small informational interview, for about 5 minutes and followed by a 30 minutes longer interview in the next week. Since I'm not in SF, it was conducted through skype. I think the HR department must be quite busy because the interviewer were late for about 15 minutes. The interview is standard, the interviewer is very nice.
Interview Questions: There is no unexpected Question.

title: Graduate Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
On April, 25th 2013 HR department contacted me after submitting the application online on April, 24th, and scheduled a Skype preliminary interview with a recruiter.
The interview (on April, 30th 2013) lasted about 10-12 minutes and only covered general questions about my fit with the position and the working environment I would be looking for at AAU.  The recruiter then allowed me to ask questions about the position. I asked to what extent the position was a pure sales one or in between counseling and sales.  The recruiter replied that the position was a bit of both, though it was clear that, given AAU business model, the University wants Admissions Counselors to pursue high sales and enrollments.
At the end of the interview, the recruiter mentioned that, if the first interview went well, I would sit another interview with a panel, including the admissions department head.
On May, 8th 2013, I was notified that I did not pass the preliminary interview.

Questions included:
- What do you look for in the position?
- Why this job?
- Name three relevant skills that would bring to the position
- What is your ideal work environment?
- What skills and characteristics do you look for in a supervisor?
Interview Questions: What skills and characteristics do you look for in a supervisor?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Screening interview by phone > Online Skills Test > Formal HR Interview via Skype > AAU-wide Admin interview in person > Interview with Department Directors

I Interviewed with four different Academic departments within the university. It was great to have an opportunity to find the right fit! When I interviewed with my current supervisor, I knew it was IT. The others felt awkward.
Interview Questions: How does your previous experience apply in an academic setting?

title: ESL Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Nice, short, based more on my resume, references, and degrees than on anything I said in the interview. I dressed in a professional but comfortable way, got there on time, and chatted in a friendly way with the interviewer, who was very easy to talk to. They put me on a list for emergency last-minute hiring, and three months later, they called me with one day to prep for teaching a fall semester class. I did it, and after that they kept offering me work each term except for some summer sessions. Like most of their ESL teachers, I am part-time and called temporary, though they keep hiring me back.
Interview Questions: "How would you differentiate instruction in a class of several first-languages and not all exactly the same level of writing and/or speaking English?"

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Initally went to the job fair - was contacted by another recruiter to go to the interview. Had several phone interviews and a panel interview. I was asked to do a lot of role playing - pretending I was calling the student.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student who is very shy over the phone? What would you say?

title: Professional Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Standard phone screen, met with Hiring and Department Manager, background check, and then offer. 

The overall process for my role was fairly quick as the Department was in dire need to fulfill the role and required someone who had more than base knowledge of the area I would support.
Interview Questions: What are your concerns or opinions of assisting customers in a fast-paced environment?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews with this company. All fairly standard. The first was a phone interview with the recruiter and then a second in person interview with the same recruiter who was very nice and personable. The third was with someone who I was never quite clear what her role was nor did she introduced herself until I asked. I didn't get the same friendly treatment from the third interviewer. I also didn't get an offer, or a courtesy call or email letting me know. Just never another word after the 3rd interview.
Interview Questions: Role-play question. Ugh!

title: Video Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took almost 3 months... and the HR person who was supposed to be updating me on the process had to be prodded to produce a peep.  i should have taken this as a warning of things to come.
Interview Questions: none that were memorable.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick skype interview that was basic interview questions.  They asked me if I understood the position I was applying for, which I didn't completely but they were able to explain it better and didn't hold it against me.  I had an in person interview the next week and it went fine but I could tell it wasn't great.  They asked me what type work enviornment I wanted to work with and similar questions.  Although they try to mask it as something else, the position is ultimatly a sales position.
Interview Questions: Role play talking to a prospective student on the phone.  How would you find out about the type of art they do?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: This is a review of the open house process.  The process was a bit unclear, and I ended up waiting longer than I would have had I registered at the front desk before filling out my application.  Interviews were five minutes, so my advice would be to be prepared with a clear, concise "elevator speech". Rehearse while you are waiting ; )
Interview Questions: Given the five minute time limit, there was no time for curve-ball questions.  Just be prepared to sell yourself in a short period of time.

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Academy of Art University
Interview Descriptions: Very uptight feel... Really hard to connect with the two ladies who interviewed me... I left feeling like I didn't get the job. The admissions department is very uptight and ran very strict. You can be out of there in no time.
Interview Questions: The questions were not normal interview questions. I found them to be random and some caught me off guard.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Attended a job fair/mess which I signed up for after seeing their listing on craigslist.  My background and qualifications matched what they were looking for and signed up for their event.  Got email confirmation and was given the details.

From the minute I walked in, I knew it was going to be bad.  A room full of potential candidates looking for jobs.  Should have trusted my instincts and just turned around and left.

It was VERY unorganized and it seemed they had more people signing up or just walking in from the streets to their job fair than they expected.  What was shocking is that they had only 3 people from HR doing the interviews.  Had everyone fill out applications and wait.  Did I mention wait?  But lucky us, they had a video playing and catalogs so we can read how great the "school" is.  Some waited well over 1.5 hrs, but luckily me, only 1.25 hrs (rolls eyes).

When my name was finally called, I was brought to another room to talk to a recruiter.  The guy was complaining about his long day and how he hadn't had lunch yet, as we were walking to the room.  He literally glanced at my resume and asked a couple questions and rushed the 1:1 interview as he looked tired from his day of interviewing.  I wasn't even allowed to ask a question.  *Poof* the interview was done, not even 5 minutes.  My whole day wasted at the Academy of Art.

Funny, I bumped into another person who attended the event on my way out of the building and we just shared the horrible experience with one another.  All you can do is just laugh.
Interview Questions: None.  Asked two questions.  Why do you want to work here?  What do you know about our company?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process involved a phone interview, a Skype interview, a test regarding Microsoft word and excel, and a final interview. You have an hour to do the test which had about three tasks. I realized for one of my tasks, I left something in the header from the previous task and was rejected the next day.
Interview Questions: What interests you about Academy of Art?

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Rude and quick, did not take the time to speak with me, took my resume left me waiting 20 minutes then came back and took me to the bar for an interview since the location was at a hotel, sports channel too loud then said thanks.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process began with a referral from a friend who is employed at the Academy of Art University.  There was a further discussion with that friend to determine if the position would be a good fit for me and AAU.  Would I be challenged and stay interested in the job was important to both myself and AAU. Following that I had a brief phone interview with the president that was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: The interview was much more conversational than inquisitional.  They were interested in my motivations and I was interested in the growth opportunities.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: A week after I applied for the job, that I found on Craigslist, I received a phone call to set up a time to come in. The interview consisted of a HR rep and the hiring manager for the department that I was interested in. They asked me general questions that are obvious, but also asked how I handle situations in which someone does not speak English on a native level. Be prepared for that question is my recommendation.
Interview Questions: How do you handle situations in which a student does not understand or speak English as a native language?

title: Video Workstation Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I answered an ad of of Craigslist for an immediate hire for someone to manage all the video NLE workstations at an art school. The Job was advertised as full time, but when I got there they told me it was infact 32 hours a week part-time. I was told that I was to be helping ESL students get through their coursework cause the instructors had very limited office hours, and that the pay was $12.00 an hour.
Interview Questions: The interview wasn't difficult. They wan't assurance that I was a working artist and wanted examples.

title: Financial Aid Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a brief phone interview during which the recruiter assesses your phone presence.  After I scheduled a follow-up interview which for most is an in-person interview, but, since I lived in LA, mine was a skype interview.  This was also brief and last 15-20 min.  Then I was promised an in-person interview (final) that was also brief.  It took about two weeks for them to check my references, but the recruiter was really great about keeping and touch and making sure I was still interested.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult--very straightforward.

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly quick. First I I filled out an interest form online. Then I received a call and scheduled my interview. The interview itself was short - only 20 minutes. The interviewer asked approximately 10 questions. The position required more sales experience/skills than I had anticipated. The online job posting did not offer much detail about the position requirements other than general customer service and communication skills. However, it became clear during the interview that the position was sales-based.
Interview Questions: Give an example of someone who motivated you.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online for a few different positions for which I am not only qualified, but over-qualified. Anyways, got an email asking if I would be interested in the Admissions Rep. position, I emailed back, basically saying thanks but no thanks..they called a week later regardless of this disinterest.. So I figure, OK, maybe I should give em' a shot, maybe it won't be so bad? Ehh....

By the way, I completely failed that phone interview. I mean, wrecked it. I was completely thrown off by the on the spot interview. It consisted of some background questions, "Who were some of the most difficult types of students you dealt with" blah blah. I wasn't sure if I even wanted the position, and it totally came off that way, but STILL, I was granted an interview, so of course, I accepted. :)

So I go to SF and interview with a pretty nice lady. I'll be honest, I didn't get a school vibe from this chick at all. Business all the way. Cut-throat with a smile. Yikes. Anywho, she asked me all the stuff previously mentioned, "Why our school?" and a lot of repetitious crap from the phone interview. A lot of questions asking how I would deal with shy or introverted students. From this question came role play..YAY. So she acts like a disinterested student, claiming she is merely "introverted", and asks how I would motivate this individual. I stop the role play at some point and tell her that she sounds terribly disinterested and pushing on seems a bit forced, and then it hit me, FORCED, THAT'S WHAT SHE WANTS, SHE DOESN'T WANT THIS STUDENT TO DECIDE ON THEIR OWN TIME WHEN TO START SCHOOL; EMPOWERMENT? WHY LET THEM DECIDE? PUSH PUSH PUSH. 

I asked during the interview what the cut-off is for calling a student when they repeatedly don't answer their phone, she dodged and sugar-coated saying, "It's all about closure," Decoded for those of you who don't speak BS, this means "Call until you get a solid no or yes, even if this takes 439390 calls, DO IT" 

What's perhaps the worst is the exploitation of artists and their mind-set during the whole interview. She kept claiming that artists consistently need guidance and prodding in order to fulfill their goals. As if all artists get so caught up in their work they forget all about school. I know plenty of artists who went to school and loved every minute of it. If a student lacks the ambition to enroll in classes, who the hell am I to force them to do so? But students = money, and they want it, so yeah. 

Don't sell your soul, cats. Do good. Do right.
Interview Questions: Why our organization or school?

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I had previously applied for a different position with AAU, but was declined in the first stage. A couple weeks after submitting that first application, I received an email from the recruiting center about this position as Admissions Representative. I affirmed that I was interested in the admissions representative position, and a recruiting rep reached called me pretty quickly.

There was a phone screening with the recruiting rep, then a few days later an interview with a recruiter. The interview with the recruiter was straight forward, nothing out of the ordinary. I was asked to dress professionally, preferably suit and tie. After the interview, I got an email within three days of their decision.
Interview Questions: Unfortunately at this time I can't recall the questions that were asked.

title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I worked with a recruiter. The reason they gave for me not getting a callback or an inteview was because my application was not complete. Really? They are way to detail oriented for their own good.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
-got a call within a week
-short 10 minute phone interview
-interview with HR
-interview with COO
-got a call within the next 2 days
-the whole process was about 2-3 weeks
-paid 3 week training
Interview Questions: -"Our students are not like ordinary students. They're artists and they think different. How would you handle that?"

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called by an HR recruiter within a week of submitting my application. The first phone interview was mostly informational with some general inquiries about job history, as well as more specific workplace scenario questions related to the position. At the end of this conversation, we scheduled an in-person interview. I met the same recruiter I had spoken with on the phone, and there was some repetition in the questions asked. The final round was a panel interview, again featuring a blend of questions related to the candidate's interests and expertise, and more workplace scenario questions. All in all, a very straightforward interview process, and I was impressed by the quick response time after each round.
Interview Questions: List your top three strengths that you will bring to this position.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2012

title: Outreach Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: Lengthy. I went through 5 interviews total. Presentation skills a must. Lots of questions about hypothetical situations. Diplomatic approach to public relations and education. This is a front-facing position so you encounter people of all walks of life.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

The process can be long as you go through a few departments, so be patient. You may not get the department that you initially interviewed for. Be prepared to accept a job in whatever department you are assigned to.

followed by one on one with manager,

background check and previous employment check
Questions related to position that we applied for.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2012

The next interview was recorded through Skype and also conducted with the hiring agency. They submitted the video responses to AAU, and then they called me in for two in person interviews in San Francisco.
Interview Questions: Really nothing I hadn't prepared for by researching the company and general position responsibilities! The final two women that I met with were very rude and the interview lasted 5 minutes.

title: Graduate Studies Instructor Interview

Interview Questions: There was no interview

title: Macintosh Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had an in-person interview. The first interview was with the lab manager. The second interview was with HR. I received a call back within a week. with an offer. The whole process was pretty straightforward.
Interview Questions: What is the most recent version of Mac OSX called? Name three Mac-related websites/blogs that you regularly visit? How do you allocate memory to Photoshop? List the Mac applications that you are most familiar with.

title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I got a call for a different job than the one I had applied to.  The HR woman was nice enough during the phone interview and sent me the skills test.  After taking the skills test I was called in for an interview with HR then a group interview with the managers.  The HR interview was fine, but really long.  I got the sense of it being a corporation like I have heard.  I work at a different univeristy now and worked at another one in socal before this and this is NOT the same higher ed feel to it.  It very much feels like a business.  I was the first one interviewing with the managers who were cold, unfriendly, and to the point.  At one point they said the position was not for someone who slacks off or is a slow worker or doesn't work fast...they made me feel like that's what they thought I was.  They were pretty rude, and when I asked questions they almost look bothered that I did.  When I left they said "well best of luck to you" as if they had made a decision right there.  Nothing about being in touch or any friendliness at all.  A week later I got a call from HR that the managers still hadn't decided and if I would like to still be kept in the loop.  I said NO because if they hadn't decided by then, why would I want to be a second choice?  Especially after how rude my managers would be!  The job I ended up getting is much better.  I still get emails from them since my resume is still on file..NO THANK YOU!
Interview Questions: Challenges you have overcome?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
A recruiter called me very shortly after I submitted an application, and conducted a very brief phone interview. She was very nice and polite.  She gave me a brief description of the position, and asked me at least twice if it still seems like something I would be interested in.  She set up date for me to meet with another recruiter in person.
The 1:1 interview took about half an hour. This new person was very pleasant as well; very informative about the position, careful listener, great conversational skills; asked good questions, and answered mine very well.  She set up a second interview for me to meet with senior management. 
Senior management .... awful. Extremely unprofessional and rude. The interview took 20 minutes. I was interviewed by two women, one of them being COO of Admissions.  The COO did not even pretend to be paying attention: she made virtually no eye contact with me, and literally sat with her chin in her fist staring at the wall behind me most of the time. They both kept arguing with me when I said that a certain skill I use in my current job is relatable to this position.  When I asked if my understanding of this position as somewhat of sales job was correct, they said "No!" and started asking me which one of the recruiters gave me that impression; this was a bit uncomfortable because they asked it in a way that made me feel like I would get the poor woman in trouble by giving her name.  Then they gave me the signal that my time was up, and that someone would be in touch if I get the position. As I stood there thanking them for their time and saying my goodbyes, one of them turned to the other and said, "ok, which one is next?" I wasn't even to the door yet!
What still blows my mind about that experience is, how does somebody get to be COO of any place without having even the most elementary grasp of basic etiqutte?
Interview Questions: How would you convince a young person who's not sure what to do with his life that the Academy is the right place for him?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied to few positions online and got an email from a recruiter to schedule a phone interview. When she called me she sounded cold and immediately started by asking questions about my background, she even asked details about a job experience I had 5 years ago. I did not find the questions relevant and we did not discuss the positions she had. Few days later I received an email saying I had an appointment for a group interview, I didn't go.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience in this position?

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
My first conversation was with an internal recruiter; a very basic, straightforward introductory interview where she asked me a couple of basic questions like, 'Why Academy of Art?' and 'Why this industry?'.  The second interview was a 1:1 face to face interview.  I appreciated that the interviewer asked questions about my background and experience relative to the position, rather than talking about irrelevant details as some interviewers are wont to do.  After spending an hour sharing my qualifications, experience and transferable skill sets, however, I was very disappointed that I would not have an opportunity to dispel any residual misconceptions or misinterpretations of my qualifications.  It is not that I did not ask for these objections, because I definitely did, but the interviewer would not share them with me.  So, I thanked her, politely left, and noticed as we walked out of her office that she gave what I describe as an unprofessional 'look' to her colleagues across the hall (this whole office was busy with interviewees) - she thought that I did not see it as I was following her out.
The next step would have been an interview with a director and a COO that was described more than once as being, 'firm but fair'.  Work culture is described as fast-paced and hands-on, and I could tell that the amount of autonomy I had held in my former positions was going to be a problem in this organization.
Though the interviewer I met with was nice(to my face), the interview process was average and what I learned about the organization and the job in the process led me to believe that this was not a good fit.
Interview Questions: What will be the biggest challenge for you in this position?

title: Part Time Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was informal, very relaxed. Quick and no stress. I was working full time elsewhere at the time and head of ARC department was very flexible with my limited time availability.
Interview Questions: Started normal, but we just ended up chatting. Interview was one on one. I don't remember how long it took. I was refferred for the job from a department director within the company so most of the questions related to software I was able to teach as well as different subjects.

title: Early Admissions Advisor/Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I knew the rep that AAU has but I felt I had to see for myself. I initially applied for a couple positions that were posted online, that I am qualified for. Being someone that checks out their job postings, you can actually tell their is a high turnover rate within HR because the writing style of job postings even changes! Anyways, I got my first initial call from the Recruiter, who on the phone seemed really interested in me. We spoke about the different positions, and I was surprised she actually suggested she would pass along my resume to her colleagues, that hire for other departments if the position she was recruiting for wasn't to my liking. She even wanted me to consider other positions. Seems too good? Yup. My in person interview seemed totally opposite of the conversation on the phone. AAU has people lined up all day long sitting in the chairs next to you, so that person sitting there is interviewing the same one you are! It sucks that I felt the Recruiter was being a bit pretentious, I was offended actually. She asked me several times, "Why Academy?...why here?" It wasn't professional after awhile. During and after  my interview I know why people tell you don't even bother.
Interview Questions: So your job seems really exciting, why would you want to leave at this time?

title: Online Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
2 phones interview with HR recruiter and 1 with Help desk Manager. 

1 in person interview with HR and 1 with Help desk Manager. 

The whole process took 3 weeks before I accepted the position.

title: Management Job Fair Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: You check in, fill out the application, and remain seated as you wait. The recruiters call you into private rooms one by one. There were 4 different recruiters mass interviewing at one time. They expecting half the people that arrived. The other half decided to drop by unannounced for an interview. There were AAU pamphlets everywhere and two television sets playing AAU videos for you to keep yourself entertained during the 3 hour wait to be interviewed. If the recruiter is interested, they will email you back and fourth to find the right fit.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions.

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2011

Interview Questions: What was the most challenging thing you experienced in past job?

title: Instructotr Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Academy of Art University in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Not in debt at all.
Interview Questions: There were none.

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
This was a very negative interviewing experience. Initially, it seemed like a decent job, as I have a strong background in sales and the "Admissions Advisor" is really a sales position. I was interviewed by two people at the same time.  They asked me about my background and I told them that I had been the Number One sales associate for my division at a Fortune Top 40 company.  The person who was leading the interview asked why I no longer worked there and I told her that I had been laid off.  She then started arguing with me, stating that it seemed unlikely that a company would lay off its top salesperson.  I explained to her that the company cut the people who made the most and the least in commission.  She still acted like she thought I was lying.  VERY unprofessional.

It gets worse.  I asked if there was any chance of advancement in the company and the same woman told me -- and I quote -- "Well, you have to work for it.  No one's going to give you something for free."  I wish I were kidding here, but that's what she said.  I told her that I expected to work hard, but I wanted to know if there was at least potential for advancement.  She then proceeded to tell me her life's story.  How she got to this job right out college and worked hard and that's why she was in the position she was in.  In short, the interview turned out to be mostly about her.  It was weird, I thought they called because they wanted to hear about me and my qualifications.

Oh well, I'm sure that they found someone else to sell their school over the phone.  I didn't like the interview at all and I would not have worked there because the woman running the interview was in a high-ranking position and everyone seemed to report to her.

I strongly recommend looking elsewhere.
Interview Questions: What is your background?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Academy of Art University (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: This process was very easy, the HR group are very nice and explained the process very well, the interview was a little strange, the hiring manager was in the room with the HR person, the hiring manager didn't speak, the HR person asked the questions from a list of questions.

title: Admissions Representative Interview

Interview Questions: What do imagine this position entails, how do you visualize this position?

title: Student Advisor Interview
